etymology.description: 又(又) (yòu, "hand") + 𰀁(𰀁) (yù, "brush") = hand holding a brush -> writing tool
etymology.interpretation: The character 聿(yù, "brush") visually represents a hand grasping a brush, symbolizing the act of writing. This embodies the original purpose of indicating a writing tool before it was borrowed for broader meanings.

examples.chinese: 他拿起聿(聿)，在宣紙上書寫(在宣紙上書寫)。
examples.pinyin: Tā ná qǐ yù, zài xuānzhǐ shàng shūxiě.
examples.english: He picked up the brush and wrote on rice paper.

examples.chinese: 古代文士喜用聿(喜用聿)。
examples.english: Ancient literati liked to use the brush.
